conflictDescription: User Story A emphasizes simplicity and quick, distraction-free access to clinical data, implying minimal automatic interventions, while User Story B requires ALFRED to automatically activate health support and interventions even if it feels controlling, creating opposing instructions on system behavior upon health events.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to build clinical integration tools that prioritize simplicity and reliability, enabling quick and distraction-free access to vital data for medical staff.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to automatically activate health support and interventions even if it feels controlling, because I prioritize my health and well-being.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access

conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring and addressing user feedback to ensure app acceptance including exercise notifications, while User Story B strictly forbids most exercise notifications as intrusive, creating incompatible expectations on notification delivery.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to continuously monitor user feedback to quickly identify and address acceptance issues, ensuring my app meets diverse older adults' needs effectively.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to block and dismiss almost all notifications about physical exercises because I find them intrusive, overwhelming, and prefer to avoid challenging activities.
cluster: Minimal and Formal Interaction with ALFRED

conflictDescription: User Story A implies continuous monitoring and addressing user feedback including acceptance of features like hydration reminders, while User Story B forbids unsolicited hydration reminders unless explicitly requested, creating a conflict between performing an operation and strictly forbidding it under certain conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to continuously monitor user feedback to quickly identify and address acceptance issues, ensuring my app meets diverse older adults' needs effectively.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to receive hydration reminders only when I explicitly ask for them, so I can avoid unwanted interruptions and maintain control.
cluster: Minimal and Formal Interaction with ALFRED
